   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of the disconnect_cb configuration.
   23: %%
   24: 
   25: -module(diameter_dpr_SUITE).
   26: 
   27: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   28: -export([run/0,
   29:          run/1]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([
   33:          %% Framework functions
   34:          suite/0,
   35:          all/0,
   36:          init_per_suite/1,
   37:          end_per_suite/1,
   38: 
   39:          %% The test cases
   40:          client/1,
   41:          server/1,
   42:          uncommon/1,
   43:          transport/1,
   44:          service/1,
   45:          application/1
   46:         ]).
   47: 
   48: %% internal
   49: -export([connect/1,
   50:          send_dpr/1,
   51:          remove_transport/1,
   52:          stop_service/1,
   53:          check/1]).
   54: 
   55: %% disconnect_cb
   56: -export([disconnect/5]).
   57: 
   58: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   59: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc6733.hrl").
   60: 
   61: -include("diameter_util.hrl").
   62: 
   63: 
   64: %% ===========================================================================
   65: 
   66: -define(util, diameter_util).
   67: 
   68: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
   69: 
   70: -define(CLIENT, "CLIENT").
   71: -define(SERVER, "SERVER").
   72: 
   73: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
   74: -define(SERVICE(Host),
   75:         [{'Origin-Host', Host ++ ".erlang.org"},
   76:          {'Origin-Realm', "erlang.org"},
   77:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
   78:          {'Vendor-Id', hd(Host)},  %% match this in disconnect/5
   79:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
   80:          {restrict_connections, false}]).
   81: 
   82: %% Disconnect reasons that diameter passes as the first argument of a
   83: %% function configured as disconnect_cb.
   84: -define(REASONS, [transport, service, application]).
   85: 
   86: %% Valid values for Disconnect-Cause.
   87: -define(CAUSES, [0, rebooting, 1, busy, 2, goaway]).
   88: 
   89: %% Establish one client connection for each element of this list,
   90: %% configured with disconnect/5, disconnect_cb returning the specified
   91: %% value.
   92: -define(RETURNS,
   93:         [[close, {dpr, [{cause, invalid}]}],
   94:          [ignore, close],
   95:          []]
   96:         ++ [[{dpr, [{timeout, 5000}, {cause, T}]}] || T <- ?CAUSES]).
   97: 
   98: 
   99: -define(DL(F),    ?DL(F, [])).
  100: -define(DL(F, A), ?LOG("DDPRS", F, A)).
  101: 
  102: 
  103: %% ===========================================================================
  104: 
  105: suite() ->
  106:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 30}}].
  107: 
  108: all() ->
  109:     [client, server, uncommon, transport, service, application].
  110: 
  111: 
  112: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  113:     ?DUTIL:init_per_suite(Config).
  114: 
  115: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  116:     ?DUTIL:end_per_suite(Config).
  117: 
  118: 
  119: -define(tc(Name), Name(_) -> ?DL("~w -> entry", [Name]), run([Name])).
  120: 
  121: ?tc(client).
  122: ?tc(server).
  123: ?tc(uncommon).
  124: ?tc(transport).
  125: ?tc(service).
  126: ?tc(application).
  127: 
  128: 
  129: %% ===========================================================================
  130: 
  131: %% run/0
  132: 
  133: run() ->
  134:     run(all()).
  135: 
  136: %% run/1
  137: 
  138: run(List)
  139:   when is_list(List) ->
  140:     ?DL("run -> entry with"
  141:         "~n   List: ~p", [List]),
  142:     try
  143:         ?RUN([[{[fun run/1, T], 15000} || T <- List]])
  144:     after
  145:         ?DL("run(after) -> stop diameter"),
  146:         diameter:stop()
  147:     end;
  148: 
  149: run(Grp) ->
  150:     ?DL("run(~w) -> start (diameter) app", [Grp]),
  151:     ok = diameter:start(),
  152:     ?DL("run(~w) -> start (diameter) service 'server'", [Grp]),
  153:     ok = diameter:start_service(?SERVER, service(?SERVER, Grp)),
  154:     ?DL("run(~w) -> start (diameter) service 'client'", [Grp]),
  155:     ok = diameter:start_service(?CLIENT, service(?CLIENT, Grp)),
  156:     _ = lists:foldl(fun(F,A) ->
  157:                             ?DL("run(~w) -> apply"
  158:                                 "~n   F: ~p"
  159:                                 "~n   A: ~p", [Grp, F, A]),
  160:                             apply(?MODULE, F, [A])
  161:                     end,
  162:                     [{group, Grp}],
  163:                     tc(Grp)),
  164:     ?DL("run(~w) -> stop (diameter) app", [Grp]),
  165:     ok = diameter:stop(),
  166:     ?DL("run(~w) -> done", [Grp]),
  167:     ok.
  168: 
  169: tc(T)
  170:   when T == client;
  171:        T == server;
  172:        T == uncommon ->
  173:     [send_dpr];
  174: 
  175: tc(_) ->
  176:     [connect, remove_transport, stop_service, check].
  177: 
  178: service(?SERVER = Svc, _) ->
  179:     ?SERVICE(Svc)
  180:         ++ [{'Acct-Application-Id', [0,3]},
  181:             {application, [{dictionary, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733},
  182:                            {alias, common},
  183:                            {module, #diameter_callback{_ = false}}]},
  184:             {application, [{dictionary, diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733},
  185:                            {alias, acct},
  186:                            {module, #diameter_callback{_ = false}}]}];
  187: 
  188: %% Client that receives a server DPR despite no explicit support for
  189: %% Diameter common messages.
  190: service(?CLIENT = Svc, server) ->
  191:     ?SERVICE(Svc)
  192:         ++ [{'Acct-Application-Id', [3]},
  193:             {application, [{dictionary, diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733},
  194:                            {alias, acct},
  195:                            {module, #diameter_callback{_ = false}}]}];
  196: 
  197: %% Client that sends DPR despite advertised only the accounting
  198: %% application. The dictionary is required for encode.
  199: service(?CLIENT = Svc, uncommon) ->
  200:     ?SERVICE(Svc)
  201:         ++ [{'Acct-Application-Id', [3]},
  202:             {application, [{dictionary, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733},
  203:                            {alias, common},
  204:                            {module, #diameter_callback{_ = false}}]},
  205:             {application, [{dictionary, diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733},
  206:                            {alias, acct},
  207:                            {module, #diameter_callback{_ = false}}]}];
  208: 
  209: service(?CLIENT = Svc, _) ->
  210:     ?SERVICE(Svc)
  211:         ++ [{'Auth-Application-Id', [0]},
  212:             {application, [{dictionary, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733},
  213:                            {alias, common},
  214:                            {module, #diameter_callback{_ = false}}]}].
  215: 
  216: %% send_dpr/1
  217: 
  218: send_dpr(Config) ->
  219:     ?DL("~w -> entry with"
  220:         "~n   Config: ~p"
  221:         "~n   => try listen", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Config]),
  222:     LRef = ?LISTEN(?SERVER, tcp),
  223:     ?DL("~w -> try listen", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  224:     Ref  = ?CONNECT(?CLIENT, tcp, LRef, [{dpa_timeout, 10000}]),
  225:     ?DL("~w -> get sender", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  226:     Svc  = sender(group(Config)),
  227:     ?DL("~w -> get connections for ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Svc]),
  228:     Info = case diameter:service_info(Svc, connections) of
  229:                [I] ->
  230:                    I;
  231:                [] ->
  232:                    ?DL("send_dpr -> no connections found: "
  233:                        "~n   Svc:      ~p"
  234:                        "~n   Svc info: ~p"
  235:                        "~n   Services: ~p",
  236:                        [Svc,
  237:                         diameter:service_info(Svc, all),
  238:                         diameter:services()]),
  239:                    ct:fail({no_connections, Svc})
  240:            end,
  241:     {_, {TPid, _}} = lists:keyfind(peer, 1, Info),
  242:     #diameter_base_DPA{'Result-Code' = 2001}
  243:         = diameter:call(Svc,
  244:                         common,
  245:                         ['DPR', {'Origin-Host', Svc ++ ".erlang.org"},
  246:                          {'Origin-Realm', "erlang.org"},
  247:                          {'Disconnect-Cause', 0}],
  248:                         [{peer, TPid}]),
  249:     ok =  receive  %% ensure the transport dies on DPA
  250:               #diameter_event{service = ?CLIENT, info = {down, Ref, _, _}} ->
  251:                   ok
  252:           after 5000 ->
  253:                   erlang:process_info(self(), messages)
  254:           end.
  255: 
  256: %% sender/1
  257: 
  258: sender(server) ->
  259:     ?SERVER;
  260: 
  261: sender(_) ->
  262:     ?CLIENT.
  263: 
  264: %% connect/1
  265: 
  266: connect(Config) ->
  267:     Self = self(),
  268:     Grp = group(Config),
  269:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> init(Self) end), %% process for disconnect_cb to bang
  270:     LRef = ?util:listen(?SERVER, tcp),
  271:     Refs = [?util:connect(?CLIENT, tcp, LRef, opts(RCs, {Grp, Pid}))
  272:             || RCs <- ?RETURNS],
  273:     Pid ! (Grp == application orelse length(Refs)),
  274:     [{config, [Pid | Refs]} | Config].
  275: 
  276: %% remove_transport/1
  277: 
  278: %% Remove all the client transports only in the transport group.
  279: remove_transport(Config) ->
  280:     transport == group(Config)
  281:         andalso (ok = diameter:remove_transport(?CLIENT, true)),
  282:     Config.
  283: 
  284: %% stop_service/1
  285: 
  286: %% Stop the service only in the service group.
  287: stop_service(Config) ->
  288:     service == group(Config)
  289:         andalso (ok = diameter:stop_service(?CLIENT)),
  290:     Config.
  291: 
  292: %% check/1
  293: 
  294: %% Check for callbacks before diameter:stop/0, not the other way around
  295: %% for the timing reason explained below.
  296: check(Config) ->
  297:     Grp = group(Config),
  298:     [Pid | Refs] = proplists:get_value(config, Config),
  299:     Pid ! self(),                      %% ask for dictionary
  300:     Dict = receive {Pid, D} -> D end,  %% get it
  301:     check(Refs, ?RETURNS, Grp, Dict).  %% check for callbacks
  302: 
  303: %% ===========================================================================
  304: 
  305: %% Whether or not there are callbacks after diameter:stop() depends on
  306: %% timing as long as the server runs on the same node: a server
  307: %% transport could close the connection before the client has chance
  308: %% to apply its callback. Therefore, just check that there haven't
  309: %% been any callbacks yet.
  310: check(_, _, application, Dict) ->
  311:     [] = dict:to_list(Dict);
  312: 
  313: check([], [], _, _) ->
  314:     ok;
  315: 
  316: check([Ref | Refs], CBs, Grp, Dict) ->
  317:     check1(Ref, hd(CBs), Grp, Dict),
  318:     check(Refs, tl(CBs), Grp, Dict).
  319: 
  320: check1(Ref, [ignore | RCs], Reason, Dict) ->
  321:     check1(Ref, RCs, Reason, Dict);
  322: 
  323: check1(Ref, [_|_], Reason, Dict) ->
  324:     {ok, Reason} = dict:find(Ref, Dict);  %% callback with expected reason
  325: 
  326: check1(Ref, [], _, Dict) ->
  327:     error = dict:find(Ref, Dict).  %% no callback
  328: 
  329: %% ----------------------------------------
  330: 
  331: group(Config) ->
  332:     proplists:get_value(group, Config).
  333: 
  334: %% Configure the callback with the group name (= disconnect reason) as
  335: %% extra argument.
  336: opts(RCs, T) ->
  337:     [{disconnect_cb, {?MODULE, disconnect, [T, RC]}} || RC <- RCs].
  338: 
  339: %% Match the group name with the disconnect reason to ensure the
  340: %% callback is being called as expected.
  341: disconnect(Reason, Ref, Peer, {Reason, Pid}, RC) ->
  342:     io:format("disconnect: ~p ~p~n", [Ref, Reason]),
  343:     {_, #diameter_caps{vendor_id = {$C,$S}}} = Peer,
  344:     Pid ! {Reason, Ref},
  345:     RC.
  346: 
  347: init(Pid) ->
  348:     monitor(process, Pid),
  349:     exit(recv(receive T -> T end, dict:new())).
  350: 
  351: recv(true, Dict) ->
  352:     recv(0, Dict);
  353: recv(N, Dict) ->
  354:     receive
  355:         Pid when N == 0, is_pid(Pid) ->
  356:             Pid ! {self(), Dict};
  357:         {Reason, Ref} ->
  358:             recv(N - 1, dict:store(Ref, Reason, Dict));
  359:         {'DOWN', _, process, _, _} ->
  360:             ok
  361:     end.
